channel.title: Talks By Ezra Taft Benson
channel.description: General Conference talks by Ezra Taft Benson.

item.title: Life Is Eternal
item.description: My brothers and sisters—seen and unseen throughout the world: I thus address you on this solemn, yet joyful, occasion because of my conviction, supported by holy scripture, that we are all in very deed brothers and sisters, children of the same Heave

item.title: Satan’s Thrust—Youth
item.description: It has been well said that “there comes a time when the general defilement of a society becomes so great that the rising generation is put under undue pressure and cannot be said to have a fair choice between the Way of Light and the Way of Darkness.

item.title: Civic Standards for the Faithful Saints
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, seen and unseen—and we are all brothers and sisters, children of the same Father in the spirit—humbly and gratefully I stand before you on this anniversary date of the organization of the restored church of Jesus Chri

item.title: Listen to a Prophet’s Voice
item.description: This morning we sustained unanimously Harold B. Lee to what I believe is the highest office in the world, the earthly President of the church of Jesus Christ. I have known this great man longer possibly than any other one of the General Authorities.

item.title: “Watchman, Warn the Wicked”
item.description: The prophet Ezekiel declared:

item.title: Prepare Ye
item.description: My brethren and sisters, seen and unseen; we are all brothers and sisters, children of the same Father in the spirit. Humbly and gratefully I stand before you this afternoon. I have been on my knees, in fasting and prayer, as have members of my famil

item.title: Missionary Work: A Major Responsibility
item.description: Humbly and gratefully I stand before you this glorious Sabbath day. I’m sure, President Kimball, that in addition to these lovely sisters of the Tabernacle Choir, we all join in praying for you, our prophet dear, as the song says. May I say to Elder

item.title: Do Not Despair
item.description: Humbly and gratefully I approach this sacred responsibility.

item.title: The Book of Mormon Is the Word of God
item.description: I speak to you today on a most vital subject. As members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, “we believe … the Book of Mormon to be the word of God.” (.) God has so declared it, so have its writers, so have its witnesses, and so do al

item.title: A Message to the World
item.description: Humbly and gratefully I stand before you today and seek the influence of the Holy Spirit to give witness to my message.

item.title: The Constitution—A Glorious Standard
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, humbly and gratefully I stand before you today. I thank the Lord for the eternal principle of freedom, free agency, the right choice. I cherish patriotism and love of country in all lands.

item.title: Our Priceless Heritage
item.description: Humbly and gratefully I stand before you this afternoon. As president of the Council of Twelve Apostles, I want all to know that we as the Quorum of the Twelve are pleased and in full accord with the action taken this morning in enlarging the First Q

item.title: Prayer
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, humbly and gratefully I stand before you, for the second time today. I am grateful for this privilege, and I invoke the Spirit of the Lord to sustain us as I speak about the power of personal prayer and how we may imp

item.title: Ministering to Needs through the Lord’s Storehouse System
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, humbly and gratefully I respond to the request of the First Presidency to participate in this important welfare session of the conference.

item.title: “May the Kingdom of God Go Forth”
item.description: While on a recent visit to continental Europe and Scandinavia, I had occasion to hold several press conferences with foreign news reporters. These reporters were somewhat informed and appeared amazed about the Church’s growth and progress as measured

item.title: Worthy of All Acceptation
item.description: In the April general conference of this year, President Spencer W. Kimball said: “I feel the same sense of urgency about temple work for the dead as I do about the missionary work for the living, since they are basically one and the same. …

item.title: This Is a Day of Sacrifice
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, humbly and gratefully I approach this sacred assignment with a prayer in my heart that what I say will strengthen our resolve to live the principle of sacrifice as a prerequisite to a godly life, for this a day of sa

item.title: Church Government through Councils
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, as President Tanner has announced, we are pleased to announce today some developments affecting area and local Church administration. May I say at the outset that what you will see and hear is the result of months of

item.title: A Witness and a Warning
item.description: The Lord has declared this “a day of warning, and not a day of many words” (). My message is a witness and warning about some of the evils which threaten America—a land I love with all my heart. There are other countries with this same problem. You w

item.title: A Marvelous Work and a Wonder
item.description: Seven centuries before the birth of Christ, Isaiah foresaw and foretold the restoration of the gospel of Jesus Christ in these latter days. He declared it would be a “marvelous work and a wonder” to all mankind (). When Jesus appeared to the Nephites

item.title: Prepare for the Days of Tribulation
item.description: For over forty years, in a spirit of love, members of the Church have been counseled to be thrifty and self-reliant; to avoid debt; pay tithes and a generous fast offering; be industrious; and have sufficient food, clothing, and fuel on hand to last

item.title: Great Things Required of Their Fathers
item.description: When the Lord declared that “power is not given unto Satan to tempt little children, until they begin to become accountable,” He revealed that this period of childhood and unaccountability was given to children so that “great things may be required a

item.title: Joseph Smith: Prophet to Our Generation
item.description: I would like to discuss with you this morning the calling and mission of a modern prophet to our generation.

item.title: Valiant in the Testimony of Jesus
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, with a heart full of gratitude I stand before you today, thankful for your faith and prayers, for life itself and all its blessings. Today, at this Easter time, I will speak a few words about what constitutes a valian

item.title: Fundamentals of Enduring Family Relationships
item.description: Marriage is the rock foundation, the cornerstone, of civilization. No nation will ever rise above its homes.

item.title: A Call to the Priesthood: “Feed My Sheep”
item.description: My beloved brethren: This is a glorious sight! How we appreciate the service you so willingly give to the Lord. We know God will bless you for it.

item.title: A Principle with a Promise
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, one hundred and fifty years ago the Prophet Joseph Smith organized the School of the Prophets. The purpose of this school was to prepare selected members of the priesthood to preach the gospel of Jesus Christ to all t

item.title: Jesus Christ: Our Savior and Redeemer
item.description: As members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, we need to place unreserved confidence in the Lord Jesus Christ, whom we accept as the Son of God. Until the world accepts Him as the Savior of mankind, lives His teachings, and looks to

item.title: What Manner of Men Ought We to Be?
item.description: My beloved brethren, I have entitled my remarks “What Manner of Men Ought We to Be?” You will recognize this title as a variation of the question Jesus posed to the Nephites. (See .) It is a timely question for each member of the priesthood of God to

item.title: Counsel to the Saints
item.description: Ten years ago President Spencer W. Kimball stood at this pulpit. In that conference, he was sustained by Saints throughout the world as President of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Our Commission to Take the Gospel to All the World
item.description: My beloved brethren, it is a joy and an honor to greet you tonight. I have enjoyed the program very much thus far. Brother Durrant, I am grateful for men like you. I love basketball. I was never very good, but I played for the Utah Aggies. And Father

item.title: A New Witness for Christ
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, for some years now I have been deeply concerned that we are not using the Book of Mormon as God intends.

item.title: When I Was Called as a Scoutmaster
item.description: My beloved brethren, with all my heart my love goes out to you on this very important occasion. I thank the Lord for this gathering here tonight.

item.title: Our Responsibility to Share the Gospel
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, we have called a conference of mission presidents from all over the world. We have met with these wonderful men and their wives earlier this week, and they have received instruction and counsel. I therefore feel that

item.title: Preparing Yourselves for Missionary Service
item.description: My beloved brethren, this is a glorious sight. It’s a wonderful occasion to be with you. I’m grateful to see so many fathers here in the Tabernacle with their sons, and I feel assured that this is the case with our unseen audience in many locations t

item.title: Born of God
item.description: “What think ye of Christ?” (.) That question, posed by our Lord, has challenged the world for centuries.

item.title: Worthy Fathers, Worthy Sons
item.description: I speak to you tonight on the subject of worthy fathers, worthy sons. The Book of Mormon was meant for us. It was written for our day. Its scriptures are to be likened unto ourselves. (See .)

item.title: Cleansing the Inner Vessel
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, as we commence another general conference of the Church, I earnestly seek an interest in your faith and prayers that what I say may bless and edify our souls. I realize my dependence upon the Lord, and I also know tha

item.title: To the “Youth of the Noble Birthright”
item.description: My beloved brethren, this has been a glorious meeting.

item.title: A Sacred Responsibility
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I wish to testify to you that the Lord Jesus Christ stands at the head of His church—even The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. We are His earthly stewards—we hold His priesthood, administer His ordinances,

item.title: To the Young Women of the Church
item.description: Abound in Hope was the theme of this year’s General Women’s Meeting, held Saturday evening, 27 September 1986. The meeting was broadcast by satellite to meetinghouses throughout the Church, where Latter-day Saint women and girls ten years and older j

item.title: The Book of Mormon—Keystone of Our Religion
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, today I would like to speak about one of the most significant gifts given to the world in modern times. The gift I am thinking of is more important than any of the inventions that have come out of the industrial and t

item.title: Godly Characteristics of the Master
item.description: My beloved brethren: This night, as I look out over this great body of priesthood holders and think of the similar congregations throughout the world, I am stirred with a great sense of gratitude and joy for the blessings our Heavenly Father has give

item.title: The Gift of Modern Revelation
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, on this glorious occasion as we have gathered here together, I wish to give thanks to our Father in Heaven for the gift of modern revelation and particularly for the books of Latter-day scripture which He has given us

item.title: The Savior’s Visit to America
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, as we commence another great general conference of the Church, my heart is full of love and gratitude to the Latter-day Saints throughout the world.

item.title: To the Home Teachers of the Church
item.description: My beloved brethren of the priesthood, it has been a joy to be with you this evening and to be instructed by these choice men of God. I have felt of your power and faith, and I commend you for your attendance here tonight.

item.title: The Book of Mormon and the Doctrine and Covenants
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I rejoice in this great conference. I am a better man because I was here. I thank the Lord for the great record that has been made. This has been another glorious conference of the Church. I commend to each of you the

item.title: Our Divine Constitution
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, what a glorious blessing to be assembled in another great general conference of the Church. I ask for an interest in your faith and prayers as I speak to you about a subject that is very close to my heart and that aff

item.title: To the Fathers in Israel
item.description: My dear brethren, I am grateful to be here with you in this glorious assembly of the priesthood of God. I pray that the Spirit of the Lord will be with me and with you as I address you on a most vital subject. This evening I would like to speak to th

item.title: “Come unto Christ”
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, this has been another glorious conference, for which I thank the Lord and commend my brethren for their inspired counsel and the choirs for their uplifting music.

item.title: The Great Commandment—Love the Lord
item.description: My dear brethren and sisters, I thank the Lord that He in His kindness has permitted me to join with you in another glorious general conference of the Church. How I have been blessed as a result of your faith and prayers during the past few months.

item.title: To the Single Adult Brethren of the Church
item.description: My dear brethren of the Aaronic and Melchizedek Priesthood, how happy I am to be with you this evening.

item.title: “Come unto Christ, and Be Perfected in Him”
item.description: (Read by President Gordon B. Hinckley, First Counselor in the First Presidency)

item.title: To the Single Adult Sisters of the Church
item.description: My dear sisters, it is so good to be with you. This has been a glorious meeting. I have appreciated the counsel we have received from the presidents of these three great women’s organizations. Their words have been inspiring, and I commend them to yo

item.title: Flooding the Earth with the Book of Mormon
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I rejoice to be with you in another glorious general conference of the Church. I am always filled with great anxiety as I approach these conferences. But I humbly pray that the Holy Spirit will be with us in rich abun

item.title: I Testify
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, my heart is full and my feelings tender as we conclude this great general conference of the Church.

item.title: Beware of Pride
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I rejoice to be with you in another glorious general conference of the Church. How grateful I am for the love, prayers, and service of the devoted members of the Church throughout the world.

item.title: To the Children of the Church
item.description: My dear brethren and sisters, how I have rejoiced in the messages I have heard delivered from this pulpit at this great general conference of the Church.

item.title: To the Elderly in the Church
item.description: (Read by President Thomas S. Monson, Second Counselor in the First Presidency)
